string.#text: Improves the damage of War Canoes, Tlaloc Canoes, Chincha Rafts, Pirogues, and Petates Canoes.

For the rest of the game, a steady trickle of Coin enriches you, and your Estates or Silk Plantations are more productive.
Farm, Estate, Cotton Plantation and Pasture upgrades available before the Imperial Age are now free.
A Samurai musters at every Castle or Tower.
Towers get a cannon attack and more hitpoints (Towers built on walls will not benefit from the hitpoints increase).
Outposts get a cannon attack and more hitpoints (Outposts built on walls will not benefit from the hitpoints increase).
Ships 2 Palace Builders and 3 Camp Builders. Researches Fortified Cities.
Researches Tonalá Ceramics, which increase the rate at which Villagers gather from Estates and Bee Sanctuaries. Ships Chests of Coin for every shipment sent so far this game.
Iroquois warrior that hurls tomahawks into battle.
War Settlements build limit and training and research speeds increased.
Salteadores and Cruzob Infantry are stronger when nearby natural resources (Trees, Mines, Huntables, etc).

Task Villagers on the Ceremonial Grounds to perform powerful ceremonies.
Task Villagers on the Ceremonial Grounds.
Tasking Villagers on your Ceremonial Grounds invokes power for your tribe and will give you access to unique Native abilities.
To task Villagers on the Ceremonial Grounds, select the Villagers, then right-click the Ceremonial Grounds. Add additional Villagers to increase the ceremony's effect.
We'll have to decide how many of our villagers should work on the Ceremonial Grounds, and how many should be gathering and building.
The more villagers that dance at the Ceremonial Grounds, the better.
Our villagers must join the war dance at the Ceremonial Grounds.

<color=1.0, 1.0, 0.0>Civilization bonus:</color>
Warrior priests can occupy at the Ceremonial Grounds for greater effect.
<color=1.0, 1.0, 0.0>Unique units:</color>
Arrow Knights, Coyote Runner, Eagle Runner Knight, Jaguar Prowl Knight, Otontin Slinger, Puma Spearman and Skull Knight.

Nobles Hut provides excellent defense and trains elite Aztec units.
<color=1.0, 1.0, 0.0>Unique ceremonies:</color>
Healing Ceremony and Garland War Ceremony

A powerful central American nation that was well known for its conquest of neighbors. Their power was centered in Tenochtitlan, present day Mexico city.
TEAM Churches, Mosques, Field Hospitals, and Ceremonial Groundss are cheaper.

TEAM Churches, Mosques, Meeting Houses and Field Hospitals are much cheaper and their non-advanced improvements are also cheaper. Monasteries are somewhat cheaper. The Ceremonial Grounds becomes free.
Task Villagers on the Ceremonial Grounds to perform powerful ceremonies.

<color=1.0, 1.0, 0.0>Civilization bonus:</color>
Kancha Houses produce food. Receives a free Chasqui with Exploration Age shipments and with each Age-up. Chasqui's can construct Tambos (powerful Trading Posts that can receive shipments and civilians can garrison in). Military units can garrison in Kallankas and Strongholds. Priestesses can convert enemies and work at the Ceremonial Grounds.
<color=1.0, 1.0, 0.0>Unique units:</color>
Chasqui, Plumed Spearman, Chimu Runner, Jungle Bowman, Bolas Warrior, Huaraca, Maceman, Priestess and Chincha Raft.

Kallanka, Stronghold, Kancha House and Tambo
<color=1.0, 1.0, 0.0>Unique ceremonies:</color>
Moon Ceremony and Supay Ceremony

A vast South American empire known for the power of its walls and smart administration.
Doubles the effectiveness of Llamas at the Ceremonial Grounds.

Improves the effectiveness of Healers tasked to the Ceremonial Grounds.
Ships a number of Healers. Enables Healers to work at the Ceremonial Grounds.
Improves your War Chief in combat. Warrior Priests are more effective at the Ceremonial Grounds.

<color=1.0, 1.0, 0.0>Civilization bonus:</color>
Outlaw-type units occupy one less population space. Maatilas allow two resources to be gathered at once.
<color=1.0, 1.0, 0.0>Royal guard units:</color>
Pikeman (Lifgardet Pikemen), Hackapell (Björneborg Hakkapeliittas)
<color=1.0, 1.0, 0.0>Unique units:</color>
Karelian Jaeger, Karelian Spearman, White Guard, Hackapell, Finnish Riders.
<color=1.0, 1.0, 0.0>Unique buildings:</color>
Mercenary Lodging, Sámi Reindeer Farm, Finnish Docks, Maatila.

For a long time, the Finns and the Swedes shared the same history, since Finnish mercenaries served in the swedish army. Later they were conquered by the Soviets and only recently have they successfully fought for their independence.

<color=1.0, 1.0, 0.0>Civilization bonus:</color>
Cheaper stables: the Elephant Stables. Entire cavalry and artillery consists of Elephants.
<color=1.0, 1.0, 0.0>Unique units:</color>
Bhuddist Archer, Bokator Swordsman, Ph'Kak Warrior, Angkor Guard, War Elephant, Elephant Archer, Flamethrower Elephant, Ballista Elephant, Powder Keg Elephant.
<color=1.0, 1.0, 0.0>Unique buildings:</color>
Elepant Stables, Chicken Coop, Tower.
<color=1.0, 1.0, 0.0>Wonders:</color>
Angkor Wat, Baksei Chamkrong, The Victory Gate, Lolei Temple, Phnom Yat.

The Khmer Empire was at it's peak in the 12th century. In the post-angkorian era the Khmers were concentrated mostly in Cambodia, where they were constantly fighting back invaders, namely the Siamese and the Vietnamese, and later, the French.
Villagers gather food from hunted animals faster.

Significantly reduces the cost of Malocas.
Ships 5 Huskies and increases their build limit
Ships 3 Huskies and allows more to be trained at the Town Center

<color=1.0, 1.0, 0.0>Civilization bonus:</color>
<color=1.0, 1.0, 0.0>Civilization bonus:</color>
The Zulu get a small amount of Influence every time they train a unit and their cattle trickles Influence 3 times faster than other African civilizations. The Ikhanda will spawn a Matriarch upon being built and more can be sent from their Homecity. Matriarchs will spawn Zulu infantry and cavalry over time.
<color=1.0, 1.0, 0.0>Age-Up Alliances:</color> (each grant extra bonuses)
 • Two new technologies at the Ikhanda
 • Units/Builders at the Royal Hut or Town Center
<color=1.0, 1.0, 0.0>Unique Resource:</color>
Influence is a powerful resource spent primarily on Native Warriors and Upgrades. All unlocked features cost Influence. Generate it by training units, building Trading Posts and by largely by controlling large herds of Livestock.
<color=1.0, 1.0, 0.0>Unique units:</color>
Zulu Archer, Iviyo, iNdluyengwe, Nsizwa, Zulu Horse Archer, Zulu Knight, Umpakati, Battle Wagon, Bull Ram.
<color=1.0, 1.0, 0.0>Unique Buildings:</color>
Ikhanda, iQukwane, Herbalist Market, Kraal, Royal Hut.

The Zulu Kingdom grew to dominate much of what is today KwaZulu-Natal and Southern Africa. In 1879, the British Empire invaded, beginning the Anglo-Zulu War. After an initial Zulu victory at the Battle of Isandlwana in January, the British Army regrouped and defeated the Zulus in July during the Battle of Ulundi.

<color=1.0, 1.0, 0.0>Civilization bonus:</color>
Monuments generate Influence, and allow nearby gathering villagers to generate XP. Egyptian Fields can switch between Food, Gold and Wood gathering.
<color=1.0, 1.0, 0.0>Age-Up Alliances:</color> (each grant extra bonuses)
 • Two new technologies at the Monument
 • Units/Builders at the Palace or Town Center
<color=1.0, 1.0, 0.0>Unique Resource:</color>
Influence is a powerful resource spent primarily on Native Warriors and Upgrades. All unlocked features cost Influence. Generate it with Monuments, Trading Posts and by controlling large herds of Livestock.
<color=1.0, 1.0, 0.0>Unique units:</color>
Egyptiote, Fellahin Musketeer, Bazinger, Mameluke, Camel Javelineer, Gatling Gun, Gatling Camel.
<color=1.0, 1.0, 0.0>Unique Buildings:</color>
Egyptian Field, Monument, Mosque.

Egypt's heartland, the Nile River valley and delta, was the home of one of the principal civilizations of the ancient Middle East and, like Mesopotamia farther east, was the site of one of the world's earliest urban and literate societies.

10 Villagers and 3 Rapa Nui Camp Builder\n \nGod Power: Marine Scouts - Temporarily reveals every Dock, Ship, Fish and Whale on the map and increases the gather rates of your ships from fish and whales by 200%.

7 Villagers and 2 Rapa Nui Camp Builder\n \nGod Power: Marine Scouts - Temporarily reveals every Dock, Ship, Fish and Whale on the map and increases the gather rates of your ships from fish and whales by 150%.

3 Villagers and 2 Rapa Nui Camp Builder\n \nGod Power: Marine Scouts - Temporarily reveals every Dock, Ship, Fish and Whale on the map and increases the gather rates of your ships from fish and whales by 100%.

2 Villagers and 1 Rapa Nui Camp Builder\n \nGod Power: Marine Scouts - Temporarily reveals every Dock, Ship, Fish and Whale on the map and increases the gather rates of your ships from fish and whales by 50%.
15 Obsidian Archers\n \nGod Power: Blessing of Creation - Temporarily decreases the train time of your land military units by 60%.
10 Obsidian Archers\n \nGod Power: Blessing of Creation - Temporarily decreases the train time of your land military units by 45%.
6 Obsidian Archers\n \nGod Power: Blessing of Creation - Temporarily decreases the train time of your land military units by 35%.
3 Obsidian Archers\n \nGod Power: Blessing of Creation - Temporarily decreases the train time of your land military units by 25%.

<color=1.0, 1.0, 0.0>Civilization bonus:</color>
Polynesian civilizations age up by selecting a different deity each age at the Temple, becoming said deity's temple and unlocking a unique God Power. Each civilization also has a signature statue that provides an array of effects - In the case of the Rapa Nui, these statues are Moais.
<color=1.0, 1.0, 0.0>Unique units:</color>
Mata'A Spearman, Obsidian Archer, Mata'A Spear Thrower, Matatoa, Tribal Lancer, Rapa Nui Hunter, Hot Rock Slinger, Flaming Ram, Giant Slingshot.
<color=1.0, 1.0, 0.0>Unique buildings:</color>
Hare Paenga, Vegetable Patch, Siege Kahus.
<color=1.0, 1.0, 0.0>Unique Statue:</color>
Moai

The Rapa Nui are the Polynesian peoples indigenous to Easter Island. Hotu Matuꞌa led his people from Hiva and then landed at Anakena beach, where they spread out across the island, sub-divided it between clans claiming descent from his sons, and lived for more than a thousand years in their isolated island home at the southeastern tip of the Polynesian Triangle.
An Oovoo must be placed on a Mine
Praying Grounds must be built close to a Church.
Mercenaries from Malta that throw flaming hoops.
Slow, but infinite Food and Wood
Slow, infinite source of Food or Wood that supports up to 10 gatherers.

<color=1.0, 1.0, 0.0>Civilization bonus:</color>
The Inuit start the game with 4 regular villagers and 4 huskies, the later which can only gather meat from huntables and herdables as well as participate in ceremonies in the Ceremonial Grounds. They can ship more and allow them to be trained at the Town Center through homecity shipments.
<color=1.0, 1.0, 0.0>Unique units:</color>
Quatliq, Unniak, Igliktuks, Arctic Hunter, Nanukttuk, Qamutiik, Wolf Pack, Ikualaik, Innak.
<color=1.0, 1.0, 0.0>Unique buildings:</color>
Igloo, Hunting Camp, Insuksuk, Tikigak, Ice Fishing Hole, Animal Husbandry.
<color=1.0, 1.0, 0.0>Unique Ceremonies:</color>
Ice Fishing Ceremony

The semi-nomadic Inuit were fishermen and hunters harvesting lakes, seas, ice platforms and tundra. While there are some allegations that Inuit were hostile to early French and English explorers, fishermen and whalers, more recent research suggests that the early relations with whaling stations along the Labrador coast and later James Bay were based on a mutual interest in trade.

<color=1.0, 1.0, 0.0>Civilization bonus:</color>
Rainforest Native Civilization - Cannot gather Gold. And they don't use it whatsoever, having an economy based on Food and Wood alone. Their War Chief can convert animal treasure guardians and allow a small number of them to be trained at the Animal Husbandry.
<color=1.0, 1.0, 0.0>Unique units:</color>
Blackwood Archer, Iaguarabá, Ka'amondosara, Pokababá, Tamoio Fire Starter, Guayacuru, Jaguar, Animal Treasure Guardians.
<color=1.0, 1.0, 0.0>Unique buildings:</color>
Oca, School, Maloca, Animal Husbandry.
<color=1.0, 1.0, 0.0>Unique Ceremonies:</color>
Amazon Regeneration Ceremony

The Tupi people inhabited almost all of Brazil's coast when the Portuguese first arrived there. Their population was estimated at 1 million people, nearly equal to the population of Portugal at the time. They were divided into tribes, each tribe numbering from 300 to 2,000 people.
Increases the build limit for Villagers by 45.
Railroad Company worker that throws dynamite at buildings dealing heavy siege damage and has a weak hand attack to fend off other units.
Long-ranged archer that fires flaming arrows laced with petroleum dealing burning damage over time. Good against artillery and buildings.
Cherokee warrior that throws spears at enemies at range and also has a strong hand attack.
Elite Cherokee female warrior that throws tomahawks at range and beats down cavalry at melee range.
Cherokee elder warrior that throws axes at enemies.

Railroad Company work station that has an ongoing agreement with the Cherokee, where the Cherokee provide protection from robbers and the Railroad Company provides economic improvements and exchanges one resource for another.
Trains Guayacurus, Jaguars, and other animals tamed by the Tupi.
Fast moving Korean artillery that shoots firework rockets from a great distance.
Villagers gather Coin from Cotton Plantations faster.
The Cherokee purchases the Railroad Post, allowing it to trickle a small amount of Gold increased by the number of Trading Posts you currently have. Enables Railroad Workers at the Artillery Foundry.
Railroads Company work post under the Cherokee's protection. Serves as a Market and can research a tech that allows the recruitment of American Railroad Workers.

<color=1.0, 1.0, 0.0>Civilization bonus:</color>
Can ship a large number of Emprisoned Settlers from their homecity, and research a Big tech in the Railroad Work Post that allows dynamite throwing Railroad Workers to be trained at the Artillery Foundry.
<color=1.0, 1.0, 0.0>Unique units:</color>
Chickamauga War Club, Cherokee Rifleman, Bowie Knifeman, Ghigau, Cherokee Lighthorse, Cherokee Mounted Rifle, Black Locust Bowman, Railroad Worker.
<color=1.0, 1.0, 0.0>Unique buildings:</color>
Cherokee Hut, Railroad Work Post, Cherokee War Hut, Campfire.
<color=1.0, 1.0, 0.0>Unique Ceremonies:</color>
Green Corn Ceremony

The Cherokee are one of the indigenous peoples of the Southeastern Woodlands of the United States. Prior to the 18th century, they were concentrated in their homelands, in towns along river valleys of what is now southwestern North Carolina, southeastern Tennessee, edges of western South Carolina, northern Georgia and northeastern Alabama.
Extremely well trained blind monk from the Order of the Lotus. Exceptional against cavalry and infantry.
Skilled Shinobi that throws shurikens at enenemies. Good against other infantry.
Korean swordsman bound by honor. Good against cavalry and buildings.
Highly trained korean assassin. Very effective against a diverse array of units.
Heavily armored cavalry proficient with the bow and arrow.
Elite Korean horseman carrying a heavy musket. Good in general but particularly against cavalry.
Asian cannon that shoots an exploding arrow. Better against infantry and artillery than buildings.
Asian siege weapon that shoots fire at a short range. Better against infantry than buildings.

Villagers gather Food from Gharb Plains Farmsteads and Influence from Argan Plantations faster.
Villagers gather Food from Gharb Plains Farmsteads and Influence from Argan Plantations much faster.

Combines the function of a Mill and the african Livestock Market. Can fatten and sell Livestock for wood or gold.

Mayan cavalry armed with a spear. Good against Infantry.

A Jesuit woman that has armed herself to defend her faith. Has a strong ranged attack.

Carib warrior with a large two-handed club.
Light artillery that throws gourds filled with pepper to defeat infantry or deal high siege damage.
Alligator trained by the Caribs to fight alongside them.

Defensive building that shoots arrows at nearby enemies.
A western marketplace where the Caribs go to sell Food and Wood in exchange for Gold, as well as research early economic improvements.

Buccaneer on horseback with a powerful short ranged attack.
A sunken ship carrying treasure found by the pirates that they mine for Coin. Limited to 10 gatherers.

The Kingdom of Morocco is the most westerly of the North African countries known as the Maghreb. The traditional domain of indigenous peoples now collectively known as Berbers, Morocco has been subject to extensive migration and has long been the location of urban communities that were originally settled by peoples from outside the region.

The Yoruba are most notable for the Oyo Empire under its oba, known as the Alaafin of Oyo, and were active in the African slave trade during the 18th century. The Yoruba often demanded slaves as a form of tribute of subject populations, who in turn sometimes made war on other peoples to capture the required slaves.

The Maya were a Mesoamerican civilization noted for its logosyllabic script — the most sophisticated and highly developed writing system in pre-Columbian Americas, as well as for its art, architecture, mathematics, calendar, and astronomical system.
Crewmates gather Food from Pirate Settlements faster

At the time of Spanish contact, the Caribs were one of the dominant groups in the Caribbean, which owes its name to them. They lived throughout northeastern South America, Trinidad and Tobago, Barbados, the Windward Islands, Dominica, and possibly the southern Leeward Islands.

<color=1.0, 1.0, 0.0>Civilization bonus:</color>
Jesuits can't gather Gold directly. Instead, they generate from tithe collections in their churches and by gathering from Estates that are available from the Colonial Age. Jesuits work in education, research, and cultural pursuits. Jesuits also give retreats, minister in hospitals and parishes, sponsor direct social ministries, and promote ecumenical dialogue.

In the 17th century, buccaneers lived on the Caribbean island of Hispaniola and its tiny turtle-shaped neighbour, Tortuga. The governors of Caribbean islands such as Jamaica paid the buccaneers to attack Spanish treasure ships and ports, but although raids began in this way, with official backing, the buccaneers gradually became more and more out of control, eventually attacking any ship they thought carried valuable cargo, whether it belonged to an enemy country or not. The buccaneers had become true pirates.

Boris Godunov was the most noted member of an ancient family of Tatar origin. He was descended from the Tatar Prince Chet, who went from the Golden Horde to Russia and founded the Ipatiev Monastery in Kostroma. During the first years of his reign, he was both popular and prosperous, and ruled well. He cultivated friendly relations with the Scandinavians and hoped to take a bride from a foreign royal house, thereby increasing the dignity of his own dynasty.

Yonaguska, who was known as Drowning Bear (the English meaning of his name), was a leader among the Cherokee of the Lower Towns of North Carolina. As a result of a vision, in 1819 he banished liquor from his people's territory. During the Indian Removal of the late 1830s, he was the only chief who remained in the hills to rebuild the Eastern Band of Cherokee Indians, joined by others who had escaped or eluded the United States soldiers.
Villagers gather Wood and Gold from Inuit Plantations faster.

Ignatius of Loyola, venerated as Saint Ignatius of Loyola, was a Spanish Catholic priest and theologian, who, with Peter Faber and Francis Xavier, founded the religious order of the Society of Jesus (The Jesuits), and became its first Superior General. He envisioned the purpose of the Society of Jesus to be missionary work and teaching.

Sir Henry Morgan was a Welsh privateer, plantation owner, and, later, Lieutenant Governor of Jamaica. From his base in Port Royal, Jamaica, he raided settlements and shipping on the Spanish Main, becoming wealthy as he did so. He is, to this day, the most prominent figure in the history of the pirate crews of the Caribbean

The first recognised Carib Queen, Delores MacDavid, was installed in 1875, marking the beginning of the position, after the last major indigenous leaders had been killed or overthrown in the late 1700s. As the first Carib Queen, MacDavid successfully balanced the influence of the Catholic Church with the need to preserve traditional Amerindian culture and customs.

María Uicab was a priestess and Maya leader, born in Yucatán. She flourished during the Caste War of Yucatán, where she was influential in the Cruzoob religious movement. A charismatic woman, she had a skill for making her followers obey her by appealing to their superstitions. In a temple in the city of Tulum, she supposedly interpreted "the voices of three crosses." The crosses stood upon an altar, and Uicab claimed to be able to interpret their commands.

Sagbua Okukenu became the first Alake of Egbaland, ruling between August 8, 1854 to August 31, 1862, becoming the first Alake to reign in the fortified city of Abeokuta. As an ex-civil chief, he had the support of the civil chiefs during his reign, but was opposed by both the war chiefs and the trade chiefs, who had both profited from the state of anarchy, but Okukenu managed to maintain order in his kingdom despite their efforts.

Moulay Hassan was among the most successful sultans. He increased the power of the makhzen in Morocco and at a time when so much of the rest of Africa was falling under foreign control, he brought in military and administrative reforms to strengthen the regime within its own territory, and he carried out an active military and diplomatic program on the periphery.

Born as Yi San, he was the son of Lady Hyegyeong and Crown Prince Sado who was put to death by his own father, King Yeongjo. In 1775 King Jeongjo was appointed regent. After he ascent to full power he spent much of his reign trying to clear his father's name.

Cunhambebe was an aboriginal Indian chieftain of the Tupinambá tribe. Cunhambebe was also the main force and elected chief of the Tamoyo Confederation, a military alliance between the sea coast tribes against the Portuguese colonists. The Tamoyo Confederation waged war against the Portuguese until the Peace of Iperoig in 1567. They also fought the Portuguese forces in alliance with the French invaders commanded by Nicolas Durand de Villegaignon, a Huguenot admiral, in the historical episode which became known as the France Antarctique.

Jose Kusugak was a beloved Inuit Leader. He helped broker the 1993 deal between the Canadian government and the Inuit that created the territory of Nunavut. He proceeded to serve as president of the organization administering the treaty, Nunavut Tunngavik. In 2010, when then president Paul Kaludjak was ousted for alleged improper spending, Kusugak stepped in again, as interim president. He also served as president of the Inuit national organization, Inuit Tapiriit Kanatami.
Chests of coin purchased by the Caribs.

The Zulu will never surrender! But today, we are willing to let you win.
Our people is a peaceful one, our place is not on the battlefield. Please allow us to retreat and return to our tundra.

I believe this whole encounter was but a misunderstanding. The Jesuits only attempt to purge the world of darkness, although I see your heart is closed to the light. But today you proved superior in the battlefield, so allow us to leave so you can claim at least some redemption in the eyes of God.
As the Sun sets for the Cherokee, a new moon rises in the sky... maybe we can bask in its light together?
Stop! What are you doing?! Please, stop destroying this city, and take what you want with you! But know this: someday you too will fall under our influence!
The Yoruba are everywhere! Your victory today does not mean our defeat!.. But today, we wish to surrender...
Our town is in ruins... we can no longer fight your invasion... Can you find it in your heart to allow the Mayan empire to rise again one day?

Hotu Matu'a was the first king of Easter Island. Chaos was reigning at their original home, but his high priest Haumaka had a vision in his sleep about an untouched land - Easter Island - and Hotu Matu'a chooses to migrate there with his people. When he arrived at Rapa Nui, the king disembarked at Anakena, which is why the bay was called Haŋa Rau O Te 'Ariki - The King's Bay".
You may have won here today, but the Gods will still protect us in our Island... would you let us return home without more bloodshed?

Mehmed Ali was the Albanian Ottoman governor and the de facto ruler of Egypt from 1805 to 1848, who is considered the founder of modern Egypt. At the height of his rule, he controlled Lower Egypt, Upper Egypt, Sudan and parts of Arabia and the entire Levant.

Alexander Ball was an important figure in the diplomatic and military events that brought Malta under British rule. Universally loved by the Maltese, Ball visited the islands for the first time on 12 October 1798. Whenever Ball appeared in public, the passers-by in the streets stood uncovered until he had passed; the clamours of the market-place were hushed at his entrance and then exchanged for shouts of joy and welcome. His mission was to sustain and continue the siege and blockade of the French forces in Malta, aided by certain Portuguese naval forces.

Shaka Zulu was the founder of the Zulu Kingdom from 1816 to 1828. He was one of the most influential monarchs of the Zulu, responsible for re-organizing the military into a formidable force via a series of wide-reaching and influential reforms.

Carl Gustaf Emil Mannerheim was a Finnish statesman and military leader who served as the leader of the White Guard during the Finnish Civil War of 1918. He also played a key role during World War II where he served as the Chief of Defense of Finland's defense forces. Thanks to his achievements, Mannerheim is regarded as Finland's greatest statesman.

Ang Duong's rule benefited a kingdom that suffered from several centuries of royal dissent and decline. His politics focused on sustained national unity and identity and the minimization of foreign interference. He issued the first substantial revision of the legal codex in centuries, and he encouraged and supervised religious and cultural reforms.

The Charrúa people were semi-nomadic hunter-gatherers who lived throughout Uruguay and the Northeast of Argentina as well as Southern Brazil. The Charrúa warriors became very skilled in battle and for this reason they are pivotal heroes in modern Uruguayan culture. Allegedly, the Charrúas killed the Spanish explorers on their first arrival. This led to three centuries of resistance and rebellion. Not only did the Charrúas fight against the Spanish; they were also involved in battles at times against the British, Portuguese and later Brazilian powers.

Newman Haynes “Old Man” Clanton and his sons arrived in Arizona Territory in 1873, where they were initially involved in freighting and ranching. In 1878, the Clantons were avidly involved in outlaw pursuits. With “Old Man” Clanton at the gang's helm, the “Cowboys” controlled the territory from Tombstone, Arizona, to the Animas Valley of New Mexico, operating undaunted until Marshal Virgil Earp began to come down on them when he was elected. This led to the famous Gunfight at the O.K. Corral on October 26, 1881.

While you waste your time looking for trinkets, we prepare to defend and strike back against your forces.

If you can't even find a few treasures, what hope could you possibly hold that you can stand up to a whole empire?
This trade site is now a part of the Oyo Empire!
I see you are taking advantage of the head start in treasure gathering I have granted you.
All these treasures fit really well next to our Orishas.
If your shortcomings are so apparent this early on, as demonstrated by your negligent treasure gathering, I doubt you will find success later on.
Oh no! How are you going to trade now that you last this trade site?
No! I was going to get that!
One more treasure for the trade!
Did you know treasure gathering helps build your economy? You seem oblivious to it.
Our necessity beats your greed. Destroying your trade site was just a demonstration of that sentiment.
Being a good treasure gatherer does not make you a good warrior. And soon we'll find out just how good a warrior you are.
Another boon to share with the village.
Maybe you should consider gathering a few nuggets. It never hurts to be prepared, and the winter will test you too.
This trade site belongs to the Rapa Nui now. Try and take it back! It won't be easy.
Bah! You and your blasted treasures! You'll be dead before you even get to use them.
Our island will prosper with this find!
Clearly you are not a good explorer, since you can't even gather treasure. Your forces will be annihilated as soon as they set foot in our island.
Oops, how clumsy! Now I went and broke your Trading Post!
Are you in the mood for sharing? You know I'll just take that from ya anyway...
It's hard to say no to a treasure... so I'll say yes!
Have you considered looking for some treasure? Personally, I've been doing it for quite some time and I find it rather enjoyable!
This trade site fits better within the Orinoco trade route.
Don't get too greedy, some of those treasures might be poisoned gifts.
Our keen eyes always helped us find treasures.
Seems like you are having some trouble finding treasure. Or are you not even trying?
Hope you didn't need this trade site! We will be waiting for you to try and take it back.
Let's see how your trinkets fare against our poisoned arrows!
If you can't find the treasures right in front of you, how do you think you will spot us amongst the trees?
Many tried to tame the Wild West but never could... I tip my hat to you sir. May we surrender?
You better not bring a knife to a gun fight! This is about to be one of the most epic showdowns of all time!
Ah, nothing beats a hearty meal!
Couldn't have stolen it better myself!
Some wood for the townsfolk's houses.
You couldn't provide for these natives anyway! They will fare much better as our allies.
Come on, slowpoke! If you lag behind in age, you won't be able to stand up to our firepower.
Who's helping you advance so fast?! Doesn't matter! I'll have both of your heads on a platter by the end of this battle!
Sorry pal! This here trade site belongs to us now.
Yes, pile as much treasure as you can. All the better for when we steal it from you.
Let's take this back to town!
Better hope your enemies are doing even worse at treasure gathering than you are. Because you sure are doing terribly.
To those natives really want to be your allies? Did you ask them?
A Trading Post?! Eh... I don't see that lasting for very long.
I guess that's the end of that...
Now that wasn't very nice, was it?!
Those natives won't stick with you for long if you don't give them anything in return. It's best you leave them to our care.
That Trading Post won't be helping you much. We'll rob the train long before it delivers you any goods.
Destroy my property all you want. I've got a stick a dynamite with your name on it too.
Do you think destroying my Town Center gives you any advantage? We can make camp anywhere!
Are you so desperate to win that you would enslave another people?
Your rush to control a trade site speaks much about your greed. And your weakness.
A decision you may come to regret.
Your insistence on violence is not going to end well for anyone!
We will free those natives from your grasp!
You people and your trade sites. Don't you know the best trades are the ones you make with nature?
The Tupi shall have their revenge!
You can burn our buildings, but we can still find refuge in the trees!
What false promises have you made to those natives so that they would help you?
Don't get too comfortable in that trade site. It won't belong to you for much longer.
How dare you?! Prepare to feel the consequences of your actions!
One more Town Center, one less Town Center, with all the wood in our rainforest we can build as many as you destroy!
Don't drag those natives to their demise alongside you.
How exactly do you think that Trading Post is going to help you against the Rapa Nui?
This assault will not be forgotten. You have been marked.
Ha! That Town Center was nothing but a distraction!
Those natives will abandon you quickly once they realize they can prosper much more within my sphere of influence.
I must admit I am a bit envious of that Trading Post. Guess I'll just have to blow it up and place one of my own in that trade site.
You think I'll just overlook this?! You better prepare yourself for my counter strike!
No! My Town Center! Look at what you've done!
Seeking the help of the Natives so soon? If you are so weak in numbers you will find it hard to face the army of the Oyo Empire.
That Trading Post is a strategical advantage you won't have for long.
You are a fool if you think this puts you in any advantage! This is but a minor setback for the Yoruba!
The destruction of my Town Center means nothing! The Oyo Empire is wherever the Yoruba are!
Those Natives must be confused. They would never ally themselves with you if they knew what I could offer them.
That Trading Post is bothering me. I will probably dispose of it soon.
Hmph! It's only a matter of time until I get that site back!
Do you think this assures you victory? You should know by now from past history that the Mayans are not so easy to conquer!
Was the alliance to those Natives a strategical move, or an act of desperation?
The sands of desert will swallow that Trading Post soon enough. And if they don't, I will.
A small nuisance, but nothing I haven't accounted for.
Your strategy is proving effective, but I may surprise you yet.
An ally? How pathetic are you that you need those natives to carry you to victory?
Was that Trading Post really your priority? Good luck on your trading once we have razed your whole town.
You dare challenge us?! You will feel the extent of the Zulu might!
Provoke us at your own risk. You will come to regret destroying our Town Center!
Those Natives would benefit much more from a Visita being built in their village. Why don't you remove your Trading Post before I'm forced to do it for you.
A Trading Post? Already? What aspects of your growth are you neglecting?
An offense against the Jesuits is an offense against God! Are you prepare to face His divine judgement?!
What makes you think that destroying our Town Center ensures you any advantage? Our builders must be building another one as we speak!
So you seek the help of the Natives? Let's see how they fare against my mercenaries.
That Trading Post is just another obstacle for me to get rid of.
That was a mistake you will not be afforded to repeat!
Your brutality will be met in kind once it is I that is raiding your village!
Let us hope you are capable of maintaining that alliance. I fear you don't stand much of a chance without it.
Keep your eyes on your Trading Post. Blink too slowly and when you open your eyes again it might not be there anymore.
Steel yourself, each blow you deliver will be returned to you in threefold!
Destroy as you wish, the Khmers are experienced in rising from the ashes!
Those Natives will not help you if you don't know how to guide them.
Let's hope the resources you spent on that Trading Post this early pay off later on.
If destruction is all your capable of doing, than destruction is also what you shall receive!
You may burn our wood, but you will not dim our spirits!
My heart hurts for the people that needs to endure your tyranny.
Is that Trading Post your only hope for a prospering economy?
This destruction does not come as a surprise. We are prepared to strike back in kind!
By destroying our Town Center you only prove you are no better than the savages you claim we are!

The Circle of Ossus are a powerful secret cult whose goal is to obtain power, riches and eternal life to assert dominance in the New World. After being seemingly defeated by John and Amelia Black and their allies, Piérre Beaumont is revealed to have faked his death and rebuilt the Circle of Ossus in the shadows, now strong enough to reveal themselves to the world and take their place as a global superpower.

Newman Haynes Clanton, more commonly known as, "Old Man" Clanton, led a large gang of outlaws, "The Cowboys" who operated along the Mexican border, stealing cattle, robbing stagecoaches, ambushing teamsters, and committing murder.

Piérre Beaumont was the last Grand Inquisitor of the Circle of Ossus, before his supposed death at the hands of Amelia Black and the downfall of the Circle of Ossus. But he survived his assassination attempt and has rebuilt the Circle of Ossus and now they're stronger than ever and Beaumont has a thirst for conquest.
This is impossible! How could you have beaten us?! Well... if you are strong enough to defeat us today, maybe we could both benefit from an alliance in the future?
What do we have here? Another fool with a death wish? Maybe you should surrender now to spare yourself and your people from dying at the hands of the Circle of Ossus.
More meat for our white beasts!
Coin keeps the world spinning, and alliances swaying...
A fine piece of Wood for our global expansion!
These natives all but begged for me to destroy your Trading Post when I offered them a sip from the Fountain of Youth. You won't be forging alliances with them any time soon.
I am not surprised to see you struggling to advance in age, seen as your strategic prowess is yet to be confirmed to be more than mediocre.
Impressive! Keep it up and maybe I'll find another use for your head other than for decoration after I detach it from the rest of your body.
Don't be too upset. This trade site was meant to be controlled by me all along. But try to take it back, I'm sure someone as keen-eyed as you won't fall into any traps.
Fitting. A common rat scavenging for scraps.
Even Nature bows to the Circle of Ossus!
Your defeat is already guaranteed, but maybe you should give yourself a fighting chance and look for some treasures before I take them all.
Enjoy that alliance while it lasts. There's nothing you can offer those natives that I can't offer threefold.
First to claim a trade site are we? Let's see if you are also the first to lose one.
You are treading on treacherous waters. I am not an enemy you can survive making.
Each Town Center you destroy it's two more we build up! Give up now while you still have a chance!

The reign of Queen Tamar represented the peak of Georgia's might in the whole history of the nation. Tamar's armies crushed new Turkish invasions from the south-east and south and launched several successful campaigns into Turkish-controlled Southern Armenia.

Caalus was king or paramount chief of the Calusa people of Southwest Florida from about 1556 until his death. He ruled over one of the most powerful and prosperous chiefdoms in the region at the time, controlling the coastal areas of southwest Florida and wielding influence throughout the southern peninsula. Contemporary Europeans recognized him as the most powerful chief in Florida.
While our victory appears unlikely, an alliance may still prove useful to you in the future. Will you consider this offer?
Challenging the Calusa will be a challenge you might not want to endure. Approach our shores at your own risk. You have been warned.
The great feast grows even richer!
We will build plenty of canoes with this wood.
These natives shall no longer suffer under your grasp. They'll thrive much better as our allies.
Is the New World proving too much of a challenge for you? If you can't advance in age, I don't know how you expect to keep up in combat.
It is a pity we must battle each other. I would be eager to learn how you were able to advance in age so quickly.
We are already building water canals to make better use of this trade site than you ever could.
Wise. You will need every advantage you can gather against us.
The Calusa prove themselves the superior scavengers once again!
Interesting choice of tactics. We shall see if your decision to ignore treasures will pay off in the long run.
The first to conquer will also be the first to fall. Those natives will surely be rebelling against you soon enough.
Is this your only trick? Rush to claim a trade site? You are going to have to do better than that if you hope to defeat us.
These foolish attempts to hinder us only strengthen our resolve. Our retaliation will be swift and deadly.
Destroy our Town Center and we will build another one somewhere else! This does not mean the Calusa's defeat.

Tamar was the first woman to rule Georgia in her own right and embarked on an energetic foreign policy aided by the decline of the hostile Seljuk Turks. Relying on a powerful military elite, Tamar was able to build on the successes of her predecessors to consolidate an empire which dominated the Caucasus for decades.

Leo II was the tenth Armenian lord and the first king to be crowned. During his reign, Leo succeeded in establishing Cilician Armenia as a powerful and unified Christian state with a pre-eminence in political affairs. Leo eagerly led his kingdom alongside the armies of the Third Crusade and provided the crusaders with provisions, guides, pack animals and all manner of aid. Under his rule, Armenian power in Cilicia was at its apogee.
You have fought valiantly. The Knights of St. John are willing to lay down their swords for you.
In the name of the Knights of St. John, I welcome you into this battlefield. Let us fight with valor and honor.
Finding gold reminds me of someone I once loved... She would appreciate this discovery.
The hulls of our Galleys will be more reinforced still!
You may have provided your native allies with riches, but you forgot to give them a sense of purpose.
While I admire the virtue of patience, it may be unwise to linger at an early age. I hope you can rise to the challenge of the coming battle.
You have already proven your skill in technological advancements, now it is your heart that will be tested on the battlefield.
It is regrettable that it must come to this, but we cannot allow you to reap the benefits from this Trading Post.
A commendable find! I have nothing but respect for a resourceful opponent.
The land repays us for our service.
There is no shame in seeking the bounties of the land. A good general knows to seek every oportunity to strengthen their cause, even if it means collecting some nuggets.
I question your need to claim the natives so soon. But if you honor your alliance, I'm sure they will prove to be a great asset.
Trading will not win you battles. Maybe you should prioritize preparing for combat instead of acquiring some meaningless baubles.
Your employment of underhanded tactics lets us know all we need to assess your strategy. We will be prepared.
You have destroyed our Town Center, but you will find that scattering the Knights of St. John will prove to be a harder task than that.
Your victory has been nothing but the culmination of unfortunate circumstances. You were lucky... but you won nonetheless, and so, I must resign.
I hope you came prepared. Everyone has doubts at first, but they all end up bending their knee to the Queen.
Just what was missing from the royal banquet!
I suppose we can make room in our coffers for a little extra gold.
Our masons will put this wood to good use.
My apologies, but these poor natives were begging to be free from your alliance. But don't worry, I will provide them what you couldn't.
Oh my! With your tardiness in advancing in age I almost mistook you for one of my peasants! My mistake, carry on.
Your quick advancements are impressive indeed. Let's see if you can keep it up.
Another obstacle I have dispatched of with ease.
Interesting. You have resorted to digging to get some sparse materials...
I suppose this could be useful.
Your lack of regard towards treasure gathering is making me appear so greedy. Maybe you should consider actually participating in this match.
Relying on the locals to carry you through this encounter? I'm affraid that is not going to be enough, dear.
Oh dear, is your fragile economy in that dire need of an early Trading Post?
That mistake is one you won't be making twice, dear.
How dare you raze my Town Center?! You will regret that..!
An unlikely victory must be even sweeter. Congratulations, I would like to surrender now.
A new challenger! How positively intriguing! I hope you have come prepared for your defeat.
How convenient! I was just starting to feel peckish.
If it shimmers, then it must be gold!
My builders are already putting this lumber to use as we speak.
What an unfortunate situation. But ultimately, these natives will fare better under my kingdom.
Are you saving your resources for the second half of this battle? You should make sure you get to advance in age before my grand finale.
How careless of you to advance in age so quickly. No matter, I will be catching up to you in no time!
I doubt a layman like you could make good use of this Trading Post. Just leave it to someone who knows better, like me, of course.
I hope those worthless trinkets can at least bring you good fortune during this encounter.
Should you really be allowing me to claim all the treasures by myself? I don't think you should be giving me all these oportunities to get ahead when your chances of winning are already so slim...
If I was in your position, I would try to rely on the natives too. Good luck...
Good, you claimed the first Trading Post... now what? Do you even know what to do with it?
That changes nothing, I didn't need that anyway!
Sticks and stones may break my Town Center, but your victory isn't any closer!
